name: The Setai

reviews.text: It used to be a great hotel but be carefull they are making works till december and they dont tell you !!!! Pool is closed and they are making works inside the hotel so when you are in your room you hear all the noises !!! Dint go until they finish is not worth it !!!!
reviews.title: Be carefull

reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous, the lobby smells very well, but The house keeper robe my Chanel wachtch and some new BCBG dresses I just bought a day before besides some other things. It was a day of shopping. They seem to be sorry but the thing is my things are gone. Also the pool was not working is now in renovation.
reviews.title: House Kipping robbed me in this hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is all about service and providing their guests with an amazing experience. The hotel is under renovation and the pools were closed, but that was just a slight issue. The staff more than made up for any inconvenience but always going a step above you expect. The lobby and center court are beautiful and relaxing, the restaurants and bar are great and the beach staff and amenities are as good as you can find anywhere. We would never stay anyplace else from this point on when we visit Miami.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Well we walked into one of the leading hotels,of the world to the sound of jack hammers jacking away. We where told pools are closed and hotel was under construction. I asked for an upgrade and was told no even though I'm with Amex and a world card holder. Boy was I mad after asking for an upgrade for me and my friend the answer was no no no. After threatening letters etc I finally managed to get for a small increase a 2 bedroom suite and it was great. No pool only beach but the staff was great. After the initial hour problem I was we'll on my way to a great stay. One last thing the buffet breakfast is AWESOME
reviews.title: Sometimes the worst experience turns into something great

reviews.text: Spacious, modern apartment suites. We were on a high floor overlooking the ocean. There is everything you could need in the room. The staff are friendly in that sort of higher establishment way, they were pleasant and helpful. There is a beautiful lounge area set within a large groundlevel waterway, so peaceful and serene, a beautiful design. However, getting a coffee in the lounge in the morning was not easy. I got the impression that the waitresses were only interested in selling breakfast. I don't eat breakfast, just wanted to enjoy the surroundings and drink coffee but I had to get up and ask for coffee while waiters walked passed me without asking if I wanted anything. There then seemed to be a bit of a problem with getting a coffee, eventually I did get it but it was cold and cost the earth. I expect to pay a lot for coffee in a place such as this but I also expect to be served and to be served a good quality product. However that is my only complaint, the pool area is lovely and the pool service excellent, the reception area and welcome on arrival was lovely.
reviews.title: Luxury in Miami

reviews.text: I stayed here 3 days and had amazing time, i found discounted rooms on airbnb and would def recommend this hotel. Also location is really convenient, steps from Nobu and other places. Ocean is near and they have nice housekeeping service.
reviews.title: Great place and really nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Suite 401 via VRBO and it couldn't have been a better choice! First, I received a great deal at about half the price of hotel website. Second, the service at the hotel is impeccable. Attention to every detail and the great service beach side is second to none. Worry free beach chairs are offered complimentary with your stay along with complimentary waters. The best part of this hotel though is its privacy and peaceful ambiance. Unlike the hotels next door - the W and Shore Club in which the pools are crowded by non-hotel guests and have pool parties with loud music, at the Setai you get to enjoy complete peace and privacy. You can always go join the party next door but at least you can come home to peace and quiet. I shall always book the Setai via VRBO.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great Hotel, Great Service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stated at the Setai on numerous occasions and absolutely love the hotel. We have stayed in both the hotel and condo tower. No matter which you choose you can't go wrong. This was our first time reserving a room through VRBO and staying in the hotel building. We didn't know what to expect but it was less expensive to stay thru VRBO so we thought we would give it a try since every stay we have had there has been awesome. This is a very expensive and exclusive hotel. I would have to say it has to be one of the best own South Beach. Restaurant is incredible, service is amazing! Our rental experience thru VRBO was easy and everything that the ad said it was going to be. Staying in room 511 was like staying in the hotel even though it is owned and leased by a third party. I would highly recommend this rental thru VRBO. Great room . Great value in a very clean upscale hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay for an awesome price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in one of Karl's suites in the Setai on our recent visit to Miami. The room was absolutely luxurious, along with being spacious and very clean. Karl was very accommodating to all our questions and concerns. The hotel itself has impeccable service and the outdoor areas are gorgeous. We really enjoyed the pools and beach area. Hoping to make it back there soon.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aron & Brenda
reviews.title: The Setai - Suite 511

reviews.text: Miami is notorious for its poor service - this is the exception. Intuitive, friendly and professional at every stage. From the sophisticated, calm Lobby, spacious rooms, superb spa and pool - you are in for a real treat. Only gripe (and its minor) is the WiFi (free) is a bit slow and the sink is designed so you have minimal space to lay things out. This is definitely the hotel that the other hotels in Miami should be trying to emulate
reviews.title: The Benchmark - service does not get better

reviews.text: 5 STAR!!! I have stayed here 10 times now... I love it! I tried staying at another hotel because setai had construction going on the dates I planned to be there. I will never make that mistake again. The service is amazing and the rooms are very nice. I will never stay anywhere else in Miami!!
reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to stay at this hotel during Columbus weekend (Miami Carnival). I tried so much to really love it...... I really did. I think it's over hyped/over priced for no reason. The room was small, very clean, and the staff was attentive. When I'm dishing out this kind of money; I don't want nice... I want an experience, and that it wasn't. I don't hate it, but I don't love it either. Will not be returning.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel...

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Setai many times. In general, their tower suites is good. Excellent location (one of the best on South Beach) . Nice views. Clean suite. Good service. Good food. Good people. Good spa.
reviews.title: Clean hotel on South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Setai twice and really enjoyed the room and proximity to the beach. For our needs, we like the location a bit further north of all the Miami Beach "action" and found the class and sophistication right to my wife's liking. This is one of her favorite hotels. Rooms are quiet and the blinds will give you near darkness just in case you stayed out late and need to sleep in. During our last stay, the warmest pool was dominated by some loud kids which was unfortunate. However, while the pool is not "the scene" for singles, it is perfect if you want to relax. The only negative is the price of the restaurants at the hotel. We usually had breakfast at Maxine's diner which is a short two block walk and found the prices for our minimalist serving size just right. If money is no object, this is a 5 star rating.
reviews.title: Quality rooms and service

reviews.text: Great hotel. Unlike "hip" hotels like W, Morgan Group, etc, that are long on looks but short on substance and attention to detail, the Setai is well done all around.
reviews.title: Perfect experience - best hotel in Miami and Top-5 in the US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location near other hotels and clubs; beautiful pool (and guests); great food.
reviews.title: worst service ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also had a rarity for Miami (and perhaps the US in general) -- great service. An Ipod cord was prompty brought up to my room upon request to connect to the stereo.
reviews.title: A little slice of the Orient in SoBe

likes.liked: — Meticulous attention to detail, Asian Feel
likes.disliked: — The cost...even if worth it, it is expensive

reviews.text: I wouldn't stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: refuge from the 2-3 star wanna be south beach hotels
Class and Syle
reviews.text: pool was fantastic (great atmosphere and very comfortable chairs) and food was great but SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE!

We had an amazing family vacation at this property. The rooms are amazing because they are the best in South Beach. We usually stay at the Delano but decided to try something different this time. The rooms here are way better than the delano and the pool area is larger but not as hip. I didn't try the beach but my family members who did said the beach was not as nice as the Delano's. Even if you never stay here, you must have dinner at the hotel's restaurant at least once. It is excellent. The decor is modern with an heavy asian flair. The common areas are very clean. Upon check in you are guided to your room and all the gadgets in your room are explained to you. Listen closely, you will need a PHD to figure out the lighting system. Pool attendants were good and the sun beds were plenty unlike Delano where you have to bribe and beg to get one. The gym is very small and there is nothing available to wipe down the machines after using them. The spa looks nice but is very overpriced. This is a great hotel but the service is less than perfect. For 1000 dollars plus tax a night, service MUST be perfect. I can't even begin to detail what went wrong with this property from the time of reservation making ( I booked 3 rooms at 1000 each and was treated like I was booking a room at Motel 6 plus the girl barely spoke english) all the way up to departure. I detailed to them which family members were staying in what room, who had kids, who was celebrating an anniversary, and what names to put each room under. If one of us ordered an iron, it went to someone else's room. Flowers were delivered to the wrong room also. Each room comes with a beach bag but our room didn't have one so I called housekeeping and it arrived 45 minutes later. I had to call again after waiting 30 minutes for it. Service in the lounge was so slow even though we told them we have a flight to catch. We ordered car service to the airport and even that was messed up. I couldn't understand for the life of me why this property thinks it's better than all the others in South Beach when it's service is so spotty. I notice that this hotel's website sometimes puts out deals for $650 a night so if you are a south beach regular and want to try this place, wait until then b/c it's not worth 1000 a night. Breakfast is ok, Delano has better breakfast items.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel but way overpriced for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The space is beautiful and Rafael, the concierge, a delight. The new pool staff -- all imported from Asia -- are now fantastic. Everything else is so-so and fantasticaly over-priced. Other than Rafael, the concierge staff is capable only of telling you where tonight's party is and granted it is So Beach so maybe that's all that's needed. but at 38, I'm a little over that scene. They cannot guide you to food, arts or even a New York Times on a Sunday. I was there one night before my husband, went to the concierge on duty and asked for a good restaurant bar I could eat at without being bothered. Though we've eaten at the Setai, it's just ok, I should have stayed put. At least the clientele are adults. He sent me to a place called "Touch" that featured disco lights, repulsive food and a barely dressed "dancer" and a drum kit. THAT is the recommendation from the concierge at the "most sophisticated" hotel in Miami. ai yi yi. The Setai also seems to be hitting rocky times as they now "host" two parties a week that turn the quiet oasis of a courtyard into a pulsating disco. One which I am sure those facing the courtyard in the small hotel rooms are privy to every second until it ends.If you must go, ask for a tower room. And, $6 for a single nescafe at breakfast with no refills is frankly insulting. Nothing special on the pool menus --if you eat there once, you're done which is a bummer because the Setai is out on the fringes and a bit of a hike to other venues. The proper restaurant is fine, nothing memorable -- except the $50 entrees. At least the wait staff there is well-trained. I can't believe Adrian Zecha, famed founder of Aman Resorts, is still involved in this tawdry toss-off.
reviews.title: Hype can't hide flaws

reviews.text: My mother, father, and I all stayed at The Setai for one night during a layover on the way home from vacation. All I can say is WOW! From the first minute we walked in we were asked if we needed assistance with our luggage and when we checked in we were given a brief tour of the property and shown how to work everything. The room was large and very clean and very well decorated. Service was incredible and probably the best I've ever had at any hotel. I purchased an EXTREMELY discounted rate for the hotel on Airbnb. I was so impressed that I bought another discounted rate on Airbnb and I'm spending a week at the Setai again very soon.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, exceptional service, incredible stay

reviews.text: I got a room at the Setai from airbnb via Karl. The hotel is great and met, exceeded all of my expectations. Great, large rooms, good service, easy access to the beach with excellent beach side service included. I got the room at a 50% discount from airbnb compared to the hotel directly. The room was privately owned but 100% serviced and managed by the hotel. It was as if we booked directly from the hotel, but at a significant discount. I would recommend Karl and the Setai to anyone. It is by far the best value in South Beach.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Setai for two short days before leaving for St. Lucia ... it was amazing! We were greeted at the door by name, given a welcome drink and taken to our suite.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great service with Asian flair

reviews.text: We were upgraded to ocean view, and the room was gorgeous. Service was spectacular - from the helpful concierge to the front desk to the bellman - no stone left un-turned.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, amazing service.
My birthday weekend
reviews.text: While we ate on the strip, we returned to the hotel for a night-cap. The hotel bar was a bit crowded, so we were allowed into a private lounge until we had a seat at the bar. The drinks and appetizers were great.

description: Situated peacefully along the gentle Atlantic Ocean, The Setai, South Beach presents a refreshing balance between the thriving South Beach scene and a serene tropical hideaway. Instilled with Asian traditions of simplicity and elegance, The Setai embodies intuitive luxury and distinctive concepts emblematic of a renowned GHM Hotel. The body and mind are recharged with The Spa at The Setai where private spa suites present an array of treatments featuring ancient healing traditions. Distinct dining experiences also await, with fresh Mediterranean cuisine amid sun and sea, and authentic Asian fare showcased al fresco or in an open theater kitchen. No desire will go unfulfilled with a paradise of Zen-like tranquility, three exquisite pools, private beach and Pool Concierge. A melding of inspiration and setting, The Setai embraces in its serenity while presenting elegant backdrops for whatever the day or night may bring.
